title: Joseph E. Yoakum: What I Saw
short_description: In 1962 at the age of 71, Joseph E. Yoakum (1891–1972) reported having a dream that inspired him to draw. Thereafter the retired veteran began a daily practice and over the next 10 years produced some 2,000 works. This exhibition follows the shifting progression of Yoakum’s work, testifying to the rich imagination of an exceptional American artist as well as to the remarkable circumstances that led to his lasting legacy.
